title: Bristol fan zone timings as Women Rugby World Cup brings free  festival  to Harbourside
body_text:
Bristol fan zone timings as Women's Rugby World Cup brings free 'festival' to Harbourside
There will be a big screen, climbing wall, mini golf, craft activities, music and circus acts
A free fan zone will bring festival vibes to Bristol's Harbourside this weekend as the city hosts a huge sporting event. The Women’s Rugby World Cup will be played at Ashton Gate Stadium in what has been hailed a 'landmark moment' for the city, with tens of thousands of spectators set to attend.
The stadium's 27,000 capacity is expected to be tested throughout but those without tickets can watch on the big screen at Canon’s Marsh Amphitheatre to watch the Red Roses and their competitors.
The free-to-enter area will host live match screenings, headline music performances, circus, dance, public art and family-friendly activities – all timed to coincide with the four knockout stage matches. Helen Godwin, the Mayor of the West of England, said: “Hosting the Women’s Rugby World Cup is a landmark moment for Bristol and the West – and our fan zone ensures that everyone can be part of it.
“This is not only a celebration of world-class sport, but also a showcase of our region’s incredible creativity, culture and community. From emerging artists to inspiring athletes, including from Bristol Bears, this is a chance for people from across the West to come together, with visitors from across the UK and beyond.”
Former England international Amber Reed and Welsh star Jenna De Vera will be MCing the stage, with dance, circus and live music acts set to perform including BBC Introducing favourites HUNNYBUZZ, who will headline the main stage next weekend.
Timings and activities
The fan zone timings listed on the tournament's website promises "a full festival-style experience, blending rugby-themed activities with community and cultural entertainment". It lists the opening times as follows:
- Saturday, 13 September 2025 - 11am-7pm
- Sunday, 14 September 2025 - 11am-7pm
- Friday, 19 September 2025 - 3pm-9pm
- Saturday, 20 September 2025 - 11am-7pm
Saturday, September 13 schedule
Bristol BID has shared the following schedule on its Instagram page for today:
- 11am: Fan zone opens
- 12.30pm: Pre-match build-up
- 1pm: New Zealand v South Africa kick-off
- 4pm: Canada vs Australia kick-off
- 7pm: Fan zone closes
Timings were not listed for the other activities aside from the big screen fixtures but it confirmed people will be able to enjoy a 'have-a-go sports zone, circus performers, rugby royalty MCs, family-friendly activities, food and drink traders and official merchandise'.
The tournament's official page also lists details of the 'Bristol zone', noting: "Visitors can try Airhop Bristol’s Cardio Wall or test their cricket skills with Sixes Social Cricket. For more adventure, take on Mendip Activity Centre’s climbing wall or mini golf with Par 59.
"There’s also fun from We The Curious, Air Giants, and a dedicated crafting station." Toilets will be available including accessible toilets and baby changing facilities.
Attendees have been reminded to dress for the weather as the location is open to the elements. Bristol is forecast light rain and sunny spells today (Saturday) but heavy rain throughout Sunday, with a yellow warning for wind set to come into force on Sunday night just after the fan zone closes.
